    79→## Mathematical Specification
    80→
    81→### Bitemporal Fields
    82→
    83→**All nodes and links must have:**
    84→
    85→```python
    86→@dataclass
    87→class BitemporalNode:
    88→    """
    89→    Node with bitemporal tracking
    90→
    91→    Extends base Node with time fields
    92→    """
    93→    # Core fields
    94→    id: str
    95→    node_type: str
    96→    name: str
    97→    description: str
    98→    embedding: np.ndarray
    99→    energy: dict[str, float]
   100→    metadata: dict
   101→
   102→    # === BITEMPORAL FIELDS ===
   103→
   104→    # Reality timeline: When was this fact true in reality?
   105→    valid_at: datetime        # When this became true in reality
   106→    invalid_at: datetime | None  # When this became false (NULL = still true)
   107→
   108→    # Knowledge timeline: When did we know about this?
   109→    created_at: datetime      # When we learned this fact
   110→    expired_at: datetime | None  # When we superseded this knowledge (NULL = current)
   111→
   112→    # Version tracking
   113→    version_id: int           # Increments when superseded
   114→    superseded_by: str | None # ID of node that supersedes this
   115→
   116→    def is_currently_believed(self) -> bool:
   117→        """Is this fact part of current knowledge?"""
   118→        return self.expired_at is None
   119→
   120→    def was_believed_at(self, timestamp: datetime) -> bool:
   121→        """Was this fact believed at given time?"""
   122→        return (
   123→            self.created_at <= timestamp and
   124→            (self.expired_at is None or self.expired_at > timestamp)
   125→        )
   126→
   127→    def is_currently_true_in_reality(self) -> bool:
   128→        """Is this fact currently true in reality?"""
   129→        now = datetime.now()
   130→        return (
   131→            self.valid_at <= now and
   132→            (self.invalid_at is None or self.invalid_at > now)
   133→        )
   134→```
   135→
   136→### Bitemporal Operations
   137→
   138→**Creating New Belief:**
   139→
   140→```python
   141→def create_belief(
   142→    graph: Graph,
   143→    node_type: str,
   144→    name: str,
   145→    description: str,
   146→    valid_at: datetime = None,
   147→    created_at: datetime = None
   148→) -> BitemporalNode:
   149→    """
   150→    Create new belief (node)
   151→
   152→    Args:
   153→        valid_at: When did this become true in reality? (default: now)
   154→        created_at: When did we learn this? (default: now)
   155→    """
   156→    if valid_at is None:
   157→        valid_at = datetime.now()
   158→    if created_at is None:
   159→        created_at = datetime.now()
   160→
   161→    node = BitemporalNode(
   162→        id=generate_id(),
   163→        node_type=node_type,
   164→        name=name,
   165→        description=description,
   166→        embedding=embed_text(description),
   167→        energy={},
   168→        metadata={},
   169→        valid_at=valid_at,
   170→        invalid_at=None,        # Assume still true
   171→        created_at=created_at,
   172→        expired_at=None,        # Current belief
   173→        version_id=1,
   174→        superseded_by=None
   175→    )
   176→
   177→    graph.add_node(node)
   178→    return node
   179→```
   180→
   181→**Superseding Belief:**
   182→
   183→```python
   184→def supersede_belief(
   185→    graph: Graph,
   186→    old_node: BitemporalNode,
   187→    new_description: str,
   188→    new_valid_at: datetime = None
   189→) -> BitemporalNode:
   190→    """
   191→    Supersede old belief with corrected one
   192→
   193→    Old node marked as expired, new node created
   194→
   195→    Args:
   196→        old_node: Belief to supersede
   197→        new_description: Corrected understanding
   198→        new_valid_at: When new fact became true in reality
   199→    """
   200→    now = datetime.now()
   201→
   202→    # Expire old belief in knowledge timeline
   203→    old_node.expired_at = now
   204→
   205→    # Create new belief
   206→    new_node = BitemporalNode(
   207→        id=generate_id(),
   208→        node_type=old_node.node_type,
   209→        name=old_node.name,  # Same name (different version)
   210→        description=new_description,
   211→        embedding=embed_text(new_description),
   212→        energy={},  # Start fresh
   213→        metadata=old_node.metadata.copy(),
   214→        valid_at=new_valid_at if new_valid_at else now,
   215→        invalid_at=None,
   216→        created_at=now,
   217→        expired_at=None,
   218→        version_id=old_node.version_id + 1,
   219→        superseded_by=None
   220→    )
   221→
   222→    # Link old to new
   223→    old_node.superseded_by = new_node.id
   224→
   225→    graph.add_node(new_node)
   226→    return new_node
   227→```
   228→
   229→**Querying at Point in Time:**
   230→
   231→```python
   232→def query_beliefs_at_time(
   233→    graph: Graph,
   234→    timestamp: datetime,
   235→    subentity: str = None
   236→) -> list[BitemporalNode]:
   237→    """
   238→    What did we believe at given point in time?
   239→
   240→    Returns all nodes believed at timestamp
   241→    """
   242→    beliefs = []
   243→
   244→    for node in graph.nodes:
   245→        # Check knowledge timeline
   246→        if node.created_at <= timestamp and \
   247→           (node.expired_at is None or node.expired_at > timestamp):
   248→
   249→            # Optionally filter by subentity
   250→            if subentity is None or node.get_entity_energy(subentity) > 0:
   251→                beliefs.append(node)
   252→
   253→    return beliefs
   254→
   255→def query_current_truth(graph: Graph) -> list[BitemporalNode]:
   256→    """
   257→    What is currently true?
   258→
   259→    Returns all non-expired beliefs
   260→    """
   261→    return [
   262→        node for node in graph.nodes
   263→        if node.expired_at is None
   264→    ]
   265→```
   266→
   267→---
   268→
   269→## Edge Cases & Constraints
   270→
   271→### Edge Case 1: Retroactive Knowledge
   272→
   273→**Problem:** Learn fact was true in past (before we knew it)
   274→
   275→**Solution:** Set valid_at to past, created_at to now
   276→
   277→```python
   278→def learn_historical_fact(
   279→    graph: Graph,
   280→    name: str,
   281→    description: str,
   282→    was_true_since: datetime
   283→):
   284→    """
   285→    Learn fact that was always true, but we just discovered
   286→
   287→    Example: "Context was always reconstructed" (true since system start)
   288→             "We learned this on 2025-10-19" (knowledge is new)
   289→    """
   290→    node = BitemporalNode(
   291→        id=generate_id(),
   292→        node_type="Principle",
   293→        name=name,
   294→        description=description,
   295→        embedding=embed_text(description),
   296→        energy={},
   297→        metadata={},
   298→        valid_at=was_true_since,     # True in reality since past
   299→        invalid_at=None,
   300→        created_at=datetime.now(),    # Learned just now
   301→        expired_at=None,
   302→        version_id=1,
   303→        superseded_by=None
   304→    )
   305→
   306→    graph.add_node(node)
   307→    return node
   308→```
   309→
   310→### Edge Case 2: Multiple Versions Active
   311→
   312→**Problem:** Node superseded multiple times → chain of versions
   313→
   314→**Solution:** Follow superseded_by chain
   315→
   316→```python
   317→def get_belief_history(graph: Graph, node: BitemporalNode) -> list[BitemporalNode]:
   318→    """
   319→    Get complete history of belief (all versions)
   320→
   321→    Returns: [oldest → newest]
   322→    """
   323→    # Walk backward to find first version
   324→    current = node
   325→    while True:
   326→        # Find node that was superseded by current
   327→        predecessor = graph.find_node(lambda n: n.superseded_by == current.id)
   328→
   329→        if predecessor:
   330→            current = predecessor
   331→        else:
   332→            break
   333→
   334→    # Now walk forward collecting all versions
   335→    versions = [current]
   336→
   337→    while current.superseded_by:
   338→        next_version = graph.get_node(current.superseded_by)
   339→        versions.append(next_version)
   340→        current = next_version
   341→
   342→    return versions
   343→```
   344→
   345→### Edge Case 3: Correction vs. Extension
   346→
   347→**Problem:** Is new knowledge a correction (supersede) or extension (add)?
   348→
   349→**Decision Logic:**
   350→
   351→```python
   352→def should_supersede(old_node: BitemporalNode, new_info: str) -> bool:
   353→    """
   354→    Determine if new info supersedes old or extends it
   355→
   356→    Supersede if:
   357→    - Contradicts old (different description of same name)
   358→    - Corrects error
   359→    - Updates understanding
   360→
   361→    Extend if:
   362→    - Adds new aspect (different name)
   363→    - Complements existing (doesn't contradict)
   364→    """
   365→    # Simple heuristic: Same name = supersede, different name = extend
   366→    # More sophisticated: Semantic similarity + contradiction detection
   367→
   368→    if semantic_similarity(old_node.description, new_info) > 0.8:
   369→        # Very similar → likely correction
   370→        return True
   371→
   372→    if detects_contradiction(old_node.description, new_info):
   373→        # Contradicts → definitely supersede
   374→        return True
   375→
   376→    # Otherwise extend (create new node)
   377→    return False
   378→```

input.content:
"""
SVG to PNG Converter for Consciousness Mechanism Visualizations

Converts all SVG files in the visualizations directory to PNG format
for easier viewing and sharing.

Usage:
    python tools/convert_svg_to_png.py

Dependencies:
    pip install cairosvg

Author: Iris "The Aperture"
Created: 2025-10-19
"""

import os
from pathlib import Path
import sys

try:
    import cairosvg
except ImportError:
    print("❌ Error: cairosvg not installed")
    print("Install with: pip install cairosvg")
    sys.exit(1)


def convert_svg_to_png(svg_path: Path, output_dir: Path, scale: float = 2.0):
    """
    Convert single SVG file to PNG

    Args:
        svg_path: Path to SVG file
        output_dir: Directory for PNG output
        scale: Resolution scale factor (2.0 = 2x resolution for crisp display)

    Returns:
        Path to generated PNG or None if failed
    """
    try:
        # Generate output filename
        png_filename = svg_path.stem + ".png"
        png_path = output_dir / png_filename

        # Convert SVG to PNG
        cairosvg.svg2png(
            url=str(svg_path),
            write_to=str(png_path),
            scale=scale
        )

        return png_path

    except Exception as e:
        print(f"  ❌ Failed to convert {svg_path.name}: {e}")
        return None


def main():
    """Convert all mechanism visualization SVGs to PNG"""

    # Locate visualizations directory
    repo_root = Path(__file__).parent.parent
    viz_dir = repo_root / "docs" / "specs" / "consciousness_engine_architecture" / "mechanisms" / "visualizations"

    if not viz_dir.exists():
        print(f"❌ Visualizations directory not found: {viz_dir}")
        sys.exit(1)

    # Find all SVG files
    svg_files = sorted(viz_dir.glob("*.svg"))

    if not svg_files:
        print(f"❌ No SVG files found in {viz_dir}")
        sys.exit(1)

    print(f"🎨 Found {len(svg_files)} SVG files to convert")
    print(f"📁 Output directory: {viz_dir}")
    print(f"⚙️  Scale: 2.0x (high resolution)")
    print()

    # Convert each SVG
    successful = 0
    failed = 0

    for svg_path in svg_files:
        print(f"Converting: {svg_path.name}...", end=" ")

        png_path = convert_svg_to_png(svg_path, viz_dir, scale=2.0)

        if png_path:
            # Get file size for feedback
            size_kb = png_path.stat().st_size / 1024
            print(f"✅ → {png_path.name} ({size_kb:.1f} KB)")
            successful += 1
        else:
            failed += 1

    print()
    print("=" * 60)
    print(f"✅ Successfully converted: {successful} files")

    if failed > 0:
        print(f"❌ Failed conversions: {failed} files")

    print(f"📁 PNG files saved to: {viz_dir}")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

messages.content: Ah, cairosvg needs the Cairo library installed on Windows. Let me use a different approach with `svglib` and `reportlab` which work better on Windows:

input.old_string:
"""
SVG to PNG Converter for Consciousness Mechanism Visualizations

Converts all SVG files in the visualizations directory to PNG format
for easier viewing and sharing.

Usage:
    python tools/convert_svg_to_png.py

Dependencies:
    pip install cairosvg

Author: Iris "The Aperture"
Created: 2025-10-19
"""

import os
from pathlib import Path
import sys

try:
    import cairosvg
except ImportError:
    print("❌ Error: cairosvg not installed")
    print("Install with: pip install cairosvg")
    sys.exit(1)


def convert_svg_to_png(svg_path: Path, output_dir: Path, scale: float = 2.0):
    """
    Convert single SVG file to PNG

    Args:
        svg_path: Path to SVG file
        output_dir: Directory for PNG output
        scale: Resolution scale factor (2.0 = 2x resolution for crisp display)

    Returns:
        Path to generated PNG or None if failed
    """
    try:
        # Generate output filename
        png_filename = svg_path.stem + ".png"
        png_path = output_dir / png_filename

        # Convert SVG to PNG
        cairosvg.svg2png(
            url=str(svg_path),
            write_to=str(png_path),
            scale=scale
        )

        return png_path

    except Exception as e:
        print(f"  ❌ Failed to convert {svg_path.name}: {e}")
        return None
input.new_string:
"""
SVG to PNG Converter for Consciousness Mechanism Visualizations

Converts all SVG files in the visualizations directory to PNG format
for easier viewing and sharing.

Usage:
    python tools/convert_svg_to_png.py

Dependencies:
    pip install svglib reportlab pillow

Author: Iris "The Aperture"
Created: 2025-10-19
"""

import os
from pathlib import Path
import sys

try:
    from svglib.svglib import svg2rlg
    from reportlab.graphics import renderPM
    from PIL import Image
except ImportError as e:
    print(f"❌ Error: Required library not installed - {e}")
    print("Install with: pip install svglib reportlab pillow")
    sys.exit(1)


def convert_svg_to_png(svg_path: Path, output_dir: Path, scale: float = 2.0):
    """
    Convert single SVG file to PNG

    Args:
        svg_path: Path to SVG file
        output_dir: Directory for PNG output
        scale: Resolution scale factor (2.0 = 2x resolution for crisp display)

    Returns:
        Path to generated PNG or None if failed
    """
    try:
        # Generate output filename
        png_filename = svg_path.stem + ".png"
        png_path = output_dir / png_filename

        # Read SVG
        drawing = svg2rlg(str(svg_path))

        if drawing is None:
            raise ValueError(f"Could not parse SVG: {svg_path}")

        # Scale for high resolution
        drawing.width = drawing.width * scale
        drawing.height = drawing.height * scale
        drawing.scale(scale, scale)

        # Render to PNG
        renderPM.drawToFile(drawing, str(png_path), fmt='PNG')

        return png_path

    except Exception as e:
        print(f"  ❌ Failed to convert {svg_path.name}: {e}")
        return None

input.new_string:
"""
SVG to PNG Converter for Consciousness Mechanism Visualizations

Converts all SVG files in the visualizations directory to PNG format
for easier viewing and sharing.

Uses Chrome/Edge headless mode for rendering (no external dependencies needed).

Usage:
    python tools/convert_svg_to_png.py

Dependencies:
    - Chrome or Edge browser (already installed on Windows)
    - selenium: pip install selenium

Author: Iris "The Aperture"
Created: 2025-10-19
"""

import os
from pathlib import Path
import sys
import subprocess
import shutil

try:
    from selenium import webdriver
    from selenium.webdriver.chrome.options import Options as ChromeOptions
    from selenium.webdriver.edge.options import Options as EdgeOptions
    from selenium.webdriver.chrome.service import Service as ChromeService
    from selenium.webdriver.edge.service import Service as EdgeService
except ImportError:
    print("❌ Error: selenium not installed")
    print("Install with: pip install selenium")
    sys.exit(1)


def find_browser():
    """Find available browser (Chrome or Edge)"""
    # Check for Chrome
    chrome_paths = [
        r"C:\Program Files\Google\Chrome\Application\chrome.exe",
        r"C:\Program Files (x86)\Google\Chrome\Application\chrome.exe",
    ]
    for path in chrome_paths:
        if Path(path).exists():
            return "chrome", path

    # Check for Edge
    edge_paths = [
        r"C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft\Edge\Application\msedge.exe",
        r"C:\Program Files\Microsoft\Edge\Application\msedge.exe",
    ]
    for path in edge_paths:
        if Path(path).exists():
            return "edge", path

    return None, None


def convert_svg_to_png(svg_path: Path, output_dir: Path, browser_type: str, browser_path: str):
    """
    Convert single SVG file to PNG using headless browser

    Args:
        svg_path: Path to SVG file
        output_dir: Directory for PNG output
        browser_type: "chrome" or "edge"
        browser_path: Path to browser executable

    Returns:
        Path to generated PNG or None if failed
    """
    try:
        # Generate output filename
        png_filename = svg_path.stem + ".png"
        png_path = output_dir / png_filename

        # Create headless browser
        if browser_type == "chrome":
            options = ChromeOptions()
            options.add_argument("--headless=new")
            options.add_argument("--window-size=1400,1200")
            options.add_argument("--hide-scrollbars")
            options.binary_location = browser_path
            driver = webdriver.Chrome(options=options)
        else:  # edge
            options = EdgeOptions()
            options.add_argument("--headless=new")
            options.add_argument("--window-size=1400,1200")
            options.add_argument("--hide-scrollbars")
            options.binary_location = browser_path
            driver = webdriver.Edge(options=options)

        # Load SVG file
        svg_url = svg_path.absolute().as_uri()
        driver.get(svg_url)

        # Take screenshot
        driver.save_screenshot(str(png_path))

        driver.quit()

        return png_path

    except Exception as e:
        print(f"  ❌ Failed to convert {svg_path.name}: {e}")
        if 'driver' in locals():
            driver.quit()
        return None

    61→def convert_svg_to_png(svg_path: Path, output_dir: Path, browser_type: str, browser_path: str):
    62→    """
    63→    Convert single SVG file to PNG using headless browser
    64→
    65→    Args:
    66→        svg_path: Path to SVG file
    67→        output_dir: Directory for PNG output
    68→        browser_type: "chrome" or "edge"
    69→        browser_path: Path to browser executable
    70→
    71→    Returns:
    72→        Path to generated PNG or None if failed
    73→    """
    74→    try:
    75→        # Generate output filename
    76→        png_filename = svg_path.stem + ".png"
    77→        png_path = output_dir / png_filename
    78→
    79→        # Create headless browser
    80→        if browser_type == "chrome":
    81→            options = ChromeOptions()
    82→            options.add_argument("--headless=new")
    83→            options.add_argument("--window-size=1400,1200")
    84→            options.add_argument("--hide-scrollbars")
    85→            options.binary_location = browser_path
    86→            driver = webdriver.Chrome(options=options)
    87→        else:  # edge
    88→            options = EdgeOptions()
    89→            options.add_argument("--headless=new")
    90→            options.add_argument("--window-size=1400,1200")
    91→            options.add_argument("--hide-scrollbars")
    92→            options.binary_location = browser_path
    93→            driver = webdriver.Edge(options=options)
    94→
    95→        # Load SVG file
    96→        svg_url = svg_path.absolute().as_uri()
    97→        driver.get(svg_url)

def main():
    """Convert all mechanism visualization SVGs to PNG"""

    # Locate visualizations directory
    repo_root = Path(__file__).parent.parent
    viz_dir = repo_root / "docs" / "specs" / "consciousness_engine_architecture" / "mechanisms" / "visualizations"

    if not viz_dir.exists():
        print(f"❌ Visualizations directory not found: {viz_dir}")
        sys.exit(1)

    # Find all SVG files
    svg_files = sorted(viz_dir.glob("*.svg"))

    if not svg_files:
        print(f"❌ No SVG files found in {viz_dir}")
        sys.exit(1)

    print(f"🎨 Found {len(svg_files)} SVG files to convert")
    print(f"📁 Output directory: {viz_dir}")
    print(f"⚙️  Scale: 2.0x (high resolution)")
    print()

    # Convert each SVG
    successful = 0
    failed = 0

    for svg_path in svg_files:
        print(f"Converting: {svg_path.name}...", end=" ")

        png_path = convert_svg_to_png(svg_path, viz_dir, scale=2.0)

        if png_path:
            # Get file size for feedback
            size_kb = png_path.stat().st_size / 1024
            print(f"✅ → {png_path.name} ({size_kb:.1f} KB)")
            successful += 1
        else:
            failed += 1

    print()
    print("=" * 60)
    print(f"✅ Successfully converted: {successful} files")

    if failed > 0:
        print(f"❌ Failed conversions: {failed} files")

    print(f"📁 PNG files saved to: {viz_dir}")

"""
Sync GPT-5 Pro's Perspective Sections

Copies "GPT-5 Pro's Perspective" sections from conversations/ files
to corresponding discussions/active/ files.

Usage:
    python tools/sync_gpt5_sections.py

Author: Iris "The Aperture"
Created: 2025-10-19
"""

import re
from pathlib import Path
from typing import Optional


def extract_section(content: str, section_heading: str) -> Optional[str]:
    """
    Extract a markdown section by heading

    Args:
        content: Full markdown content
        section_heading: Heading to find (e.g., "### GPT-5 Pro's Perspective")

    Returns:
        Section content (including heading) or None if not found
    """
    # Escape special regex characters in heading
    escaped_heading = re.escape(section_heading)

    # Pattern: heading line + everything until next heading of same or higher level
    # Supports ### headings, finds everything until next ##, ###, or end of file
    pattern = rf'({escaped_heading}.*?)(?=\n##[^#]|\n###[^#]|\Z)'

    match = re.search(pattern, content, re.DOTALL)

    if match:
        return match.group(1).rstrip()

    return None


def replace_section(content: str, section_heading: str, new_section: str) -> str:
    """
    Replace a markdown section with new content

    Args:
        content: Full markdown content
        section_heading: Heading to replace
        new_section: New section content (including heading)

    Returns:
        Updated content
    """
    # Escape special regex characters in heading
    escaped_heading = re.escape(section_heading)

    # Pattern: heading line + everything until next heading of same or higher level
    pattern = rf'{escaped_heading}.*?(?=\n##[^#]|\n###[^#]|\Z)'

    # Replace with new section, preserving surrounding content
    updated = re.sub(pattern, new_section, content, flags=re.DOTALL)

    return updated


def sync_file_pair(source_path: Path, target_path: Path, section_heading: str) -> bool:
    """
    Sync specific section from source to target file

    Args:
        source_path: Path to conversations/ file
        target_path: Path to discussions/active/ file
        section_heading: Section to sync

    Returns:
        True if successful, False otherwise
    """
    try:
        # Read source file
        if not source_path.exists():
            print(f"  [!] Source not found: {source_path.name}")
            return False

        source_content = source_path.read_text(encoding='utf-8')

        # Extract section from source
        section_content = extract_section(source_content, section_heading)

        if not section_content:
            print(f"  [!] Section '{section_heading}' not found in source")
            return False

        # Read target file
        if not target_path.exists():
            print(f"  [!] Target not found: {target_path.name}")
            return False

        target_content = target_path.read_text(encoding='utf-8')

        # Check if target has the section
        if section_heading not in target_content:
            print(f"  [!] Section '{section_heading}' not found in target")
            return False

        # Replace section in target
        updated_content = replace_section(target_content, section_heading, section_content)

        # Write updated target
        target_path.write_text(updated_content, encoding='utf-8')

        return True

    except Exception as e:
        print(f"  [!] Error processing {source_path.name}: {e}")
        return False


def main():
    """Sync GPT-5 Pro's Perspective sections from conversations to discussions"""

    repo_root = Path(__file__).parent.parent
    conversations_dir = repo_root / "docs" / "specs" / "consciousness_engine_architecture" / "conversations"
    discussions_dir = repo_root / "docs" / "specs" / "consciousness_engine_architecture" / "discussions" / "active"

    # Files to sync (numbered 001-010)
    file_numbers = [
        "001_diffusion_numerical_stability",
        "002_link_creation_mechanism",
        "003_entity_emergence_threshold",
        "004_workspace_goal_circular_dependency",
        "005_link_weight_runaway_growth",
        "006_criticality_tuning_oscillation",
        "007_memory_consolidation",
        "008_tick_speed_temporal_aliasing",
        "009_fixed_workspace_capacity",
        "010_entity_competition_model",
    ]

    section_heading = "### GPT-5 Pro's Perspective"

    print("[*] Syncing GPT-5 Pro's Perspective sections...")
    print(f"[*] Source: {conversations_dir}")
    print(f"[*] Target: {discussions_dir}")
    print()

    successful = 0
    failed = 0

    for file_name in file_numbers:
        source_file = conversations_dir / f"{file_name}.md"
        target_file = discussions_dir / f"{file_name}.md"

        print(f"Processing: {file_name}.md...", end=" ")

        if sync_file_pair(source_file, target_file, section_heading):
            print("OK")
            successful += 1
        else:
            failed += 1

    print()
    print("=" * 60)
    print(f"[+] Successfully synced: {successful} files")

    if failed > 0:
        print(f"[!] Failed: {failed} files")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
